snippet: Ms. Lopez, seeking work in academia, started as a transcriber for the Papers of Benjamin Franklin at Yale University. She would become an authority — and an admirer.
abstract: Claude-Anne Lopez, who became an authority on Benjamin Franklin after transcribing 30,000 of his documents for Yale University, dies at age 92.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Lopez, seeking work in academia, started as a transcriber for the Papers of Benjamin Franklin at Yale University. She would become an authority — and an admirer.

headline.seo: Claude-Anne Lopez, Expert on Franklin, Dies at 92
headline.main: Claude-Anne Lopez Dies at 92; Told of Franklin’s Private Life
headline.print_headline:
Claude-Anne Lopez, 92, Scholar
Exploring Franklin’s Private Life
